	Named the State Offensive Player of the Year,

Stats

Biography

Prior to Sacramento State

Played two seasons at Riverside JC (2021, 2023).

Named the State Offensive Player of the Year, Region III Offensive Player of the Year and National Division Southern League Offensive Player of the Year in 2023.

Guided Riverside JC to the California 3C2A title with a 24-21 win over College of San Mateo.

Led the state with 35 touchdown passes as a sophomore.

Threw for 3,990 yards and completed 72.6 percent of his passes (280-388).

Also rushed for 154 yards and seven touchdowns.

Amassed over 300 passing yards in six games, including a career high 524 yards at Mt. SAC JC.

Had at least one touchdown pass in 12 games, including two or more in nine contests.

Tossed six TD passes at Southwestern JC, five at Long Beach City JC and four against El Camino and at Mt. SAC JC.

Played the 2022 season at UT-Permian Basin.

Redshirted during the year, after appearing in one game.

Completed 10-of-19 passes for 246 yards with two touchdowns and three interceptions against Angelo State.

As a freshman at Riverside JC in 2021, he appeared in 10 games.

Threw for 2,398 yards and 19 touchdowns.

Highest yardage total was 322 against Palomar JC.

Had five touchdown passes against Chaffey JC.

High School

A 2020 graduate of Damien HS in La Verne, Calif.

Threw for 3,446 yards and 25 touchdowns in three varsity seasons.

Rushed for 444 yards and six touchdowns during his career.

Had 2,294 passing yards with 16 touchdowns as a junior.

Personal

Majoring in communications.

Parents are Len and Marie Barton.
